So many things wrong with your testing methods! But also you cannot claim a fair comparison as most of these tapes require some time for achieving max bond strength. They're not meant to be instant bond exactly. Some require a few hours and others require like 24 or even up to 72 to get full strength. Your results are highly deceiving, as in both for you and the audience. Plus a proper test would be adding weight and allowing it sit loaded. There's a huge difference in 'how much it can hold' vs 'how long it can hold a reasonable amount'. Instant sheer load strength is quite different than a rating constant load.

why no flex tape

Alien Tape, is a synthetic adhesive tape consisting of arrays of carbon nanotubes transferred onto a backing material of flexible polymer tape.
Which basically means it works kindof like a spiders foot, which has arrays of microscopic hairs to make it stick to surfaces. That is why it holds so well when you pull down on it, and does not at all hold when you pull the shelves, tools etc straight off.
What made the tape fail when you where pulling on it was that you did not pull in a perfectly straight line downwards.
